intro: Pleiarina triandra subsp. bornmuelleri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pleiarina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with four to five petals, and are clustered in small inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its more compact growth habit and narrower leaves compared to other members of the species.
